diagrams.description: Cloud computing's evolution began in the 1960s with time-sharing concepts enabling multiple users to access mainframes. The 1990s saw telecommunications companies offering VPN services and early virtualization. 1999 introduced Salesforce.com as pioneering SaaS. 2002 brought AWS's early web services. 2006 marked AWS EC2 launch, establishing modern IaaS. 2008 saw Google App Engine (PaaS) and Microsoft Azure announcements. The 2010s witnessed explosive growth with mobile cloud services, hybrid cloud adoption, and container technologies (Docker 2013, Kubernetes 2014). 2014 introduced serverless computing (AWS Lambda). The 2020s continue with edge computing integration, AI/ML cloud services, multi-cloud strategies, and enhanced security frameworks becoming standard.
diagrams.mermaid_code: timeline title Cloud Computing Evolution section Early Concepts 1960s : Time-sharing on mainframes : Multiple users access concept 1990s : Telecom VPN services : Early virtualization section Birth of Cloud 1999 : Salesforce.com launches : Pioneering SaaS model 2002 : AWS web services begin 2006 : AWS EC2 launch : Modern IaaS established section Platform Expansion 2008 : Google App Engine (PaaS) : Microsoft Azure announced 2010s : Mobile cloud services boom : Hybrid cloud adoption section Container Era 2013 : Docker released 2014 : Kubernetes introduced : AWS Lambda (Serverless) section Modern Cloud 2020s : Edge computing integration : AI/ML cloud services : Multi-cloud strategies : Enhanced security frameworks
